messages.subject: Subject: Re: Re: Food
messages.msgSnippet: My second son would never try watermelon. Then one summer we kept buying it and his brothers kept eating, so he decided to try it. He loved it so much he ate
messages.messageBody:
My second son would never try watermelon. Then one summer we kept buying it
and his brothers kept eating, so he decided to try it. He loved it so much he
ate almost half of it.
What's really weird is that he had no problem trying this strange fruit from
China when we were in WDW. Which by unanimous family consensus is the worst
thing any of us has put in our mouths :o)


Karena



In a message dated 6/6/2004 1:27:02 AM Mountain Standard Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:
Subject: Re: Re: Food

>
>
>When Matt was very little and I was still mega-monitoring
>food (making sure each child got a certain amount of foods from each
>food group each day), I MADE him (shudder) eat a piece of cantalope.
>He told me he didn't want it.
>
On the other hand, my son was glad when I insisted he tried another
strawberry. He had tried them several times and said he didn't like
them, but then I realised that he was actually only licking them! Have
you ever licked a strawberry? No flavour, just sort of rough and
slightly well, almost hairy. Blurk! So, believe it or not, I peeled a
strawberry for him and once he had licked that there was no stopping him!

Cally


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
